snippet: Silicon Valley scientists and billionaires announced an effort to send probes to explore Alpha Centauri, an interstellar mission that could take decades.
abstract: Group of Silicon Valley investors and scientists, led by Russian philanthropist Yuri Milner and including Stephen Hawking, announce Breakthrough Starshot, $10 billion plan to send 1,000 pocket-size robot spacecraft 4.37 light-years to Alpha Centauri, Earth's nearest star system; project will take 20 years to launch and additional 24 years before data is returned to Earth.
lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley scientists and billionaires announced an effort to send probes to explore Alpha Centauri, an interstellar mission that could take decades.

headline.main: Reaching for the Stars, Across 4.37 Light-Years
headline.print_headline: Reaching for the Stars, Across 4.37 Light-Years
